00022     public delegate void DeviceStateChangedEventHandler(object sender, DeviceStateChangedEventArgs args);

00027     public class Gps
00028     {
00029         // handle to the gps device
00030         IntPtr gpsHandle = IntPtr.Zero;
00031 
00032         // handle to the native event that is signalled when the GPS
00033         // devices gets a new location
00034         IntPtr newLocationHandle = IntPtr.Zero;
00035 
00036         // handle to the native event that is signalled when the GPS
00037         // device state changes
00038         IntPtr deviceStateChangedHandle = IntPtr.Zero;
00039 
00040         // handle to the native event that we use to stop our event
00041         // thread
00042         IntPtr stopHandle = IntPtr.Zero;
00043 
00044         // holds our event thread instance
00045         System.Threading.Thread gpsEventThread = null;
00046 
00047 
00048         event LocationChangedEventHandler locationChanged;
00049 
00053         public event LocationChangedEventHandler LocationChanged
00054         {
00055             add
00056             {
00057                 locationChanged += value;
00058 
00059                 // create our event thread only if the user decides to listen
00060                 CreateGpsEventThread();
00061             }
00062             remove
00063             {
00064                 locationChanged -= value;
00065             }
00066         }
00067 
00068 
00069         event DeviceStateChangedEventHandler deviceStateChanged;
00070 
00074         public event DeviceStateChangedEventHandler DeviceStateChanged
00075         {
00076             add
00077             {
00078                 deviceStateChanged += value;
00079 
00080                 // create our event thread only if the user decides to listen
00081                 CreateGpsEventThread();
00082             }
00083             remove
00084             {
00085                 deviceStateChanged -= value;
00086             }
00087         }

00092         public bool Opened
00093         {
00094             get { return gpsHandle != IntPtr.Zero; }
00095         }

00097         public Gps()
00098         {
00099         }

00101         ~Gps()
00102         {
00103             // make sure that the GPS was closed.
00104             Close();
00105         }

00110         public void Open()
00111         {
00112             if (!Opened)
00113             {
00114                 // create handles for GPS events
00115                 newLocationHandle = CreateEvent(IntPtr.Zero, 0, 0, null);
00116                 deviceStateChangedHandle = CreateEvent(IntPtr.Zero, 0, 0, null);
00117                 stopHandle = CreateEvent(IntPtr.Zero, 0, 0, null);
00118 
00119                 gpsHandle = GPSOpenDevice(newLocationHandle, deviceStateChangedHandle, null, 0);
00120 
00121                 // if events were hooked up before the device was opened, we'll need
00122                 // to create the gps event thread.
00123                 if (locationChanged != null || deviceStateChanged != null)
00124                 {
00125                     CreateGpsEventThread();
00126                 }
00127             }
00128         }
00129 
00133         public void Close()
00134         {
00135             if (gpsHandle != IntPtr.Zero)
00136             {
00137                 GPSCloseDevice(gpsHandle);
00138                 gpsHandle = IntPtr.Zero;
00139             }
00140 
00141             // Set our native stop event so we can exit our event thread.
00142             if (stopHandle != IntPtr.Zero)
00143             {
00144                 EventModify(stopHandle, eventSet);
00145             }
00146 
00147             // block until our event thread is finished before
00148             // we close our native event handles
00149             lock (this)
00150             {
00151                 if (newLocationHandle != IntPtr.Zero)
00152                 {
00153                     CloseHandle(newLocationHandle);
00154                     newLocationHandle = IntPtr.Zero;
00155                 }
00156 
00157                 if (deviceStateChangedHandle != IntPtr.Zero)
00158                 {
00159                     CloseHandle(deviceStateChangedHandle);
00160                     deviceStateChangedHandle = IntPtr.Zero;
00161                 }
00162 
00163                 if (stopHandle != IntPtr.Zero)
00164                 {
00165                     CloseHandle(stopHandle);
00166                     stopHandle = IntPtr.Zero;
00167                 }
00168             }
00169         }
00170 
00175         public GpsPosition GetPosition()
00176         {
00177             return GetPosition(TimeSpan.Zero);
00178         }
00179 
00180 
00189         public GpsPosition GetPosition(TimeSpan maxAge)
00190         {
00191             GpsPosition gpsPosition = null;
00192             if (Opened)
00193             {
00194                 // allocate the necessary memory on the native side.  We have a class (GpsPosition) that 
00195                 // has the same memory layout as its native counterpart
00196                 IntPtr ptr = Utils.LocalAlloc(Marshal.SizeOf(typeof(GpsPosition)));
00197 
00198                 // fill in the required fields 
00199                 gpsPosition = new GpsPosition();
00200                 gpsPosition.dwVersion = 1;
00201                 gpsPosition.dwSize = Marshal.SizeOf(typeof(GpsPosition));
00202 
00203                 // Marshal our data to the native pointer we allocated.
00204                 Marshal.StructureToPtr(gpsPosition, ptr, false);
00205 
00206                 // call native method passing in our native buffer
00207                 int result = GPSGetPosition(gpsHandle, ptr, 500000, 0);
00208                 if (result == 0)
00209                 {
00210                     // native call succeeded, marshal native data to our managed data
00211                     gpsPosition = (GpsPosition)Marshal.PtrToStructure(ptr, typeof(GpsPosition));
00212 
00213                     if (maxAge != TimeSpan.Zero)
00214                     {
00215                         // check to see if the data is recent enough.
00216                         if (!gpsPosition.TimeValid || DateTime.Now - maxAge > gpsPosition.Time)
00217                         {
00218                             gpsPosition = null;
00219                         }
00220                     }
00221                 }
00222 
00223                 // free our native memory
00224                 Utils.LocalFree(ptr);
00225             }
00226 
00227             return gpsPosition;            
00228         }
00229 
00234         public GpsDeviceState GetDeviceState()
00235         {
00236             GpsDeviceState device = null;
00237 
00238             // allocate a buffer on the native side.  Since the
00239             IntPtr pGpsDevice = Utils.LocalAlloc(GpsDeviceState.GpsDeviceStructureSize);
00240             
00241             // GPS_DEVICE structure has arrays of characters, it's easier to just
00242             // write directly into memory rather than create a managed structure with
00243             // the same layout.
00244             Marshal.WriteInt32(pGpsDevice, 1);  // write out GPS version of 1
00245             Marshal.WriteInt32(pGpsDevice, 4, GpsDeviceState.GpsDeviceStructureSize);   // write out dwSize of structure
00246 
00247             int result = GPSGetDeviceState(pGpsDevice);
00248 
00249             if (result == 0)
00250             {
00251                 // instantiate the GpsDeviceState class passing in the native pointer
00252                 device = new GpsDeviceState(pGpsDevice);
00253             }
00254 
00255             // free our native memory
00256             Utils.LocalFree(pGpsDevice);
00257 
00258             return device;
00259         }
00260 
00264         private void CreateGpsEventThread()
00265         {
00266             // we only want to create the thread if we don't have one created already 
00267             // and we have opened the gps device
00268             if (gpsEventThread == null && gpsHandle != IntPtr.Zero)
00269             {
00270                 // Create and start thread to listen for GPS events
00271                 gpsEventThread = new System.Threading.Thread(new System.Threading.ThreadStart(WaitForGpsEvents));
00272                 gpsEventThread.Start();
00273             }
00274         }
00275 
00279         private void WaitForGpsEvents()
00280         {
00281             lock (this)
00282             {
00283                 bool listening = true;
00284                 // allocate 3 handles worth of memory to pass to WaitForMultipleObjects
00285                 IntPtr handles = Utils.LocalAlloc(12);
00286 
00287                 // write the three handles we are listening for.
00288                 Marshal.WriteInt32(handles, 0, stopHandle.ToInt32());
00289                 Marshal.WriteInt32(handles, 4, deviceStateChangedHandle.ToInt32());
00290                 Marshal.WriteInt32(handles, 8, newLocationHandle.ToInt32());
00291 
00292                 while (listening)
00293                 {
00294                     int obj = WaitForMultipleObjects(3, handles, 0, -1);
00295                     if (obj != waitFailed)
00296                     {
00297                         switch (obj)
00298                         {
00299                             case 0:
00300                                 // we've been signalled to stop
00301                                 listening = false;
00302                                 break;
00303                             case 1:
00304                                 // device state has changed
00305                                 if (deviceStateChanged != null)
00306                                 {
00307                                     deviceStateChanged(this, new DeviceStateChangedEventArgs(GetDeviceState()));
00308                                 }
00309                                 break;
00310                             case 2:
00311                                 // location has changed
00312                                 if (locationChanged != null)
00313                                 {
00314                                     locationChanged(this, new LocationChangedEventArgs(GetPosition()));
00315                                 }
00316                                 break;
00317                         }
00318                     }
00319                 }
00320 
00321                 // free the memory we allocated for the native handles
00322                 Utils.LocalFree(handles);
00323 
00324                 // clear our gpsEventThread so that we can recreate this thread again
00325                 // if the events are hooked up again.
00326                 gpsEventThread = null;
00327             }
00328         }

00348         [DllImport("coredll.dll")]
00349         static extern int CloseHandle(IntPtr hObject);
00350 
00351         const int waitFailed = -1;
00352         [DllImport("coredll.dll")]
00353         static extern int WaitForMultipleObjects(int nCount, IntPtr lpHandles, int fWaitAll, int dwMilliseconds);
00354 
00355         const int eventSet = 3;
00356         [DllImport("coredll.dll")]
00357         static extern int EventModify(IntPtr hHandle, int dwFunc);
00358
